events.message: I received my new headphones yesterday but the right ear cup is damaged and making static noises when I try to use them.
The issue has been categorized as a product defect due to damage reported by the customer on the right ear cup of the headphones.
A customer support agent specialized in defective product issues has been assigned to this case to assist the customer promptly.
Hello! I’m sorry to hear about the issue with your headphones. I’m here to help resolve this as quickly as possible.
Could you please provide a few photos of the damaged ear cup and any packaging it arrived in? This will help us process your claim faster.
I have attached several pictures showing the scratch on the ear cup as well as the box it came in. Please let me know what the next steps are.
Thank you for providing those images. We can offer a replacement unit sent immediately or a full refund if you prefer. Please let us know your choice.
I would like to receive the replacement headphones, as I still want to use this model. Thank you for the quick response.
We have processed your replacement request and you should receive the new headphones within 5 business days. A shipping confirmation will be sent shortly.
Just checking in to confirm you received your replacement headphones and that they are functioning well. Please let us know if you need any further assistance.
We are closing this case as resolved. Thank you for reaching out to us and please don't hesitate to contact us again if you have any other issues.
